Reviews.Content: Loved every minute at the Genesio! Last month (September, '08) I had the pleasure of spending several days at the Genesio, my third stay in four years there. My experience at the Genesio has been good every time I have stayed there (which is, obviously, the reason I continue going there!), but the most recent stay was my most enjoyable. Simone was such a wonderful help, advising me and my travel companion on good, affordable restaurants, providing us with directions to various places in Florence that we wanted to see, which were well within walking distance of the Genesio. When we checked out, we felt like we were saying goodbye to a longtime friend! I originally stayed at the Genesio because the price was right, but if I suddenly came into big money, I would return to the Genesio for the warm atmosphere, my warm and helpful friend Simone, and the feeling of experiencing an authentic piece of Florence.
Reviews.Author: Pattirac

Reviews.Content: Florence, I love you! I stayed at Hotel Genesio for 4 nights whilst i explored this beautiful city. Remembering that a hotel is just a base whilst sightseeing I was more than adequately pleased.The rooms were clean and fresh towels daily. The hosts Simone  Leonardo were just delightful and more than helpful. Simone's knowledge of the city and all of its amazing art  sculpture was better than any guide book written. I am going back there next February for Valentines weekend xx
Reviews.Author: angela30

Reviews.Content: OK but noisy       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: piggybank2008

Reviews.Content: Lovely town, but hotel could be better! Stayed at the Hotel Genesio for 4 nights, overall it was an ok experience but not great. It was clean with fresh towels every day but quite worn, we had holes in the walls and the bathroom was not great. In some areas of the hotel there was a smell of sewage. I went together with a large group and some of us had an extremely rude welcoming by one staff member. Don't think any of us would use this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: poppyjellybaby

Reviews.Content: excellent value Stayed over 2 nights when Everton FC were in town. Room was smallish and the shower a bit cramped by the WC. Very clean with fresh towels each day.Breakfast consisted of juice/tea/coffee and muesli or cornflakes.There were also pre-packed biscuits and bread rolls with all the usual jams etc. Quite adequate but I didn't particularly like the rolls!Hotel was quite handy for the markets and touristy places and about a 15 minute walk from the station. In the same street is a grocery convenience store and a couple of pizza places.There is a bar on the corner of the next block and a tobacconist opposite.The weather was very cold and windy but the room was very well heated.The hotel is on the second floor so would be difficult for disabled people as there is no available lift.Staff were all helpful and friendly and all in all this hotel is excellent value for money. I would stay again.
Reviews.Author: billtheblue

Reviews.Content: Very good accomodation in Florence I have recentely spent 5 days in Florence during my trip to Italy. I would definetely reccomend the Hotel Genesio: nice and helpful stuff, good location and spacey room. Another plus is the very good quality of the buffet breakfast, which is included in the room booking.
Reviews.Author: Universe876

Reviews.Content: 9 wonderful days Best stay, helpful staff, very clean, very safe, breakfast open buffet!
Reviews.Author: doina_manuela

Reviews.Content: good value The Genesio gives excellent value for money considering its location.It is a safe location, the second floor with no lift could be a drawback for some people.My daughter and I stayed here during a heatwave so we were glad of the airconditioning.Our twin room was fine, the ensuite bathroom was small but ok. There were plenty of towels.Breakfast was not very exciting but satisfactory.The Genesio is within easy walking distance of the major sites in Florence.The staff were all helpful and friendly.We paid 70 euro per night for our twin room and on balance I regard that as excellent value. The hotel might seem a little basic, but considering its location one can't complain.I would stay here again and would recommend it.
Reviews.Author: Trekitalia

Reviews.Content: pleasantly pleased! the location is about 10 min walk from the station and near the central market with good food. my husband and i walked to every monument in florence from this hotel and it was a nice walk. The city isnt very big so even the farthest point is still walkable. The workers were sooooooooo nice! they helped us book train tickets and gave us directions everytime we needed them. The cleaning lady was the nicest of all the hotels i stayed in during my trip. The rooms have quality air conditioning and are pretty roomy except the bathrooms where your toilet is in the shower. the only bad thing was our bed had a board in the middle of it to hold it up. This was very uncomfortable. we didnt complain though because every night we came in so exhausted that we managed to fall asleep!
Reviews.Author: cheng35

Reviews.Content: Very good value I have just stayed at the Hotel Genesio with my sister and elderly father. We booked 3 single rooms, all of which were a decent size and very clean. The en-suite bathrooms varied, in fact one was quite small, but again were very clean and we had fresh towels every day. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful and spoke good English. Breakfast was well presented and adequate. The only downside was that the hotel was on the 2nd floor with no lift - 56 steps - but my father managed it !! Also the hotel was completely uncarpeted and therefore there was a high degree of noise at certain times.Very good value for a 2 star hotel.
Reviews.Author: Intrepid_Rover
